metadata.title: USN-7227-1 -- PCL vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that PCL incorrectly handled certain malformed files. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted file, an attacker could possibly exploit this to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7227-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libpcl-apps1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-common1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-dev - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-doc - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-features1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-filters1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-io1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-kdtree1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-keypoints1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-ml1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-octree1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-outofcore1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-people1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-recognition1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-registration1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-sample-consensus1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-search1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-segmentation1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-stereo1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-surface1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-tracking1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 libpcl-visualization1.12 - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 pcl-tools - 1.12.1+dfsg-3ubuntu0.1~esm2 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
